main event: A round, red object was observed at 30 degrees elevation in the northwest sky over Los Angeles, California on May 18, 1955.
interesting points: The object was stationary and emitted a bright glow.
The sighting lasted for 4 or 5 minutes.
The weather conditions were dry, warm, and with no moon.
Wind speeds were measured at various altitudes.
The Senior Director, 2nd Lt. Haney, had no comment on the sighting.
